docs.snippet: The fourth annual Maria Moors Cabot prizes for "distinguished service in the field of inter-American relations" have been awarded to two South American newspapers and their editors and to The Christian Science Monitor, published in Boston, Columbia...
docs.lead_paragraph: The fourth annual Maria Moors Cabot prizes for "distinguished service in the field of inter-American relations" have been awarded to two South American newspapers and their editors and to The Christian Science Monitor, published in Boston, Columbia University announced yesterday.
docs.abstract: Journalism School plans convocation for Cabot prize winners

headline.main: 3 PAPERS CHOSEN FOR CABOT PRIZES; Inter-American Awards Go to La Nacion, El Dia and The Christian Science Monitor
TO PROTEST NAZI MURDERS; Latin-American Workers to Halt Work for 15 Minutes Friday

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: At Columbia University today the fourth annual Maria Moors Cabot Prizes for "distinguished service in the field of inter-American relations" will be presented. For the first time an American journal, The Christian Science Monitor, receives this...
docs.lead_paragraph: At Columbia University today the fourth annual Maria Moors Cabot Prizes for "distinguished service in the field of inter-American relations" will be presented. For the first time an American journal, The Christian Science Monitor, receives this honor. It will be represented by its managing editor, Erwin Canham, who used to report for it the sessions of the Assembly of the League of Nations and other important foreign conferences.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED DECEM]3ER 12, 1942

docs.snippet: THE year about to close has brought fewer newcomers to philately's gallery than any other twelve-month calendar period in recent times. Normally the world's governments pay postal homage, during each year's course, to more than a hundred persons not...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE year about to close has brought fewer newcomers to philately's gallery than any other twelve-month calendar period in recent times. Normally the world's governments pay postal homage, during each year's course, to more than a hundred persons not before associated with the hobby, but 1942 has brought this honor to scarcely more than half the customary number.

docs.snippet: THE American composer Henry F. Gilbert wrote to the League of Composers at its inception in 1923. "I have been somewhat of a pioneer in American music, and that fellow usually has a hard time." We little thought then how often we would quote him...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE American composer Henry F. Gilbert wrote to the League of Composers at its inception in 1923. "I have been somewhat of a pioneer in American music, and that fellow usually has a hard time." We little thought then how often we would quote him during these twenty years.

headline.main: LEAGUE OF COMPOSERS TURNS 20; One of Its Leaders Recounts Record of Past, Examines Present And Glances at Importance of Work in the Future
FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED DECEMBER 19, 1942

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 23 -- The Argentine Military Attache, Jose C. Balbin, was expelled from this country early last September by the Mexican Government because of alleged pro-Axis activities, it was learned this evening.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 23 -- The Argentine Military Attache, Jose C. Balbin, was expelled from this country early last September by the Mexican Government because of alleged pro-Axis activities, it was learned this evening.
docs.abstract: Expulsion of Argentine Mil Attache J C Balbin revealed as arrests occur

headline.main: MEXICO EXPELLED ARGENTINE AIDE; Step Against Military Attache Revealed as Arrests Occur
